alert.note: Alert for Bell; Clay; Knox; Leslie; McCreary; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 10:22PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Bell, Knox, southern Leslie, southeastern McCreary, Whitley and southeastern Clay Counties through 1100 PM EST... At 1022 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Park Valley to near Strunk. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Williamsburg, Barbourville, Bon, Emmanuel, Tedders, Julip, Baileys Switch, Suttons Mill, Bertha Station and Wofford around 1025 PM EST. Hammond, Dixie, Bimble, Artemus, Bryants Store, Gausdale, Baughman, Boone Heights, Salt Gum and Ice Cliff around 1030 PM EST. Brush Creek, Lot, Dewitt, Birdseye, Hubbs, Old Flat Lick, Scalf, Spring Creek, Siler and Myrick around 1035 PM EST. Wilkerson, Mills, Kayjay, Essie, Gardner, Wheeler, Skidmore, Frakes, Pearl and Fourmile around 1040 PM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Pineville, Warbranch, Rella, Hoskinston, Asher, Ingram, Field, Chenoa, Wallsend, Beverly, East Pineville, Spruce Pine, Clear Creek Springs, Wasioto, Fonde, Chappell, Pruden, Wendover, Mozelle, Kettle Island and Saylor. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 1 and 15. U.S. Highway 25 East in Bell County between mile markers 9 and 18. U.S. Highway 25 East in Knox County between mile markers 1 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bell; Clay; Knox; Leslie; McCreary; Whitley
